properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow combined with strong winds will reduce visibilities to near zero over these areas today. Protect yourself from the wind, the cold and disorientation by staying safely inside. A blizzard warning is issued when winds are expected to produce blowing snow with widespread visibilities of 400 metres or less for at least 6 hours. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-09T11:59:11-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-08T20:26:11-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3249077146.2021
Area: Salluit
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Additional Snowfall: 5 to 10 cm. Location: Upper Lake Melville. Time span: continuing until this afternoon. Remarks: Snow is expected to gradually taper to flurries by late this afternoon. Northerly winds gusting up to 50 km/h may cause reduced visibility in blowing snow over exposed areas at times. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-01-08T22:59:15-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-08T14:49:15-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3610281090.2021
Area: Upper Lake Melville
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning Ended
properties.Summary:
Description: Wind speeds are no longer expected to meet warning criteria. ###
Expires: 2021-01-08T23:15:54-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-08T22:15:54-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3069811553.2021
Area: North Coast - coastal sections
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Additional Snowfall: 5 cm Maximum wind gusts: northerly 60 km/h. Time span: this evening. Remarks: The snow will combine with strong northerly winds to produce blowing snow, especially over exposed areas. ### Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-01-09T04:59:51-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-08T19:33:51-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1045623787.2021
Area: Postville - Makkovik
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring. An area of dense fog is persisting in western Portage La Prairie region and western Selkirk region tonight. Visibilities are expected to improve throughout the day on Saturday as a drier westerly flow of air develops. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-09T13:22:28-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-08T21:23:28-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4135603189.2021

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring over some areas. A few large patches of thick fog have developed over southeastern Alberta and are significantly affecting visibility along area highways. These patches are expected to clear early this afternoon. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-08T23:59:30-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-08T19:43:30-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0730261721.2021

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Locations: Hopedale and vicinity. Time span: tonight Remarks: Strong northerly winds gusting near 70 km/h will combine with snow to produce very poor visibility in blowing snow. Conditions will improve tonight as the snow begins to taper off and winds begin to diminish. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-01-09T04:59:12-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-08T19:34:12-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1831836559.2021
Area: Hopedale and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Southerly winds are reaching near 100 kilometres per hour today. These high winds will last until early this evening. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-09T11:59:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-08T20:26:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1637006418.2021
